remarks: The Extreme Value Theorem, minimum version.  A continuous function from a nonempty compact topological space to the reals attains its minimum at some point in the domain.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Aug-2014.)
statement:
bndth.1 $e |- X = U. J $.
bndth.2 $e |- K = ( topGen ` ran (,) ) $.
bndth.3 $e |- ( ph -> J e. Comp ) $.
bndth.4 $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( J Cn K ) ) $.
evth.5 $e |- ( ph -> X =/= (/) ) $.
evth2 $p |- ( ph -> E. x e. X A. y e. X ( F ` x ) <_ ( F ` y ) ) $.
$d F x y $.
$d J x y $.
$d K y $.
$d X x y $.
$d ph x y $.
